item.title: 加拿大钢厂和铝厂因美国关税而裁员
item.description: 据一家主要工会和公司称，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收关税，数百名加拿大工人，其中许多是钢铁和铝行业的工人，已经被解雇。【原文：Hundreds of Canadian workers, many in the steel and aluminum sectors, have been laid off as a result of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs, according to a major union and companies.】

item.title: 市场动荡导致交易停滞，华尔街裁员迫在眉睫
item.description: 据分析师和招聘人员称，如果未来几个月经济不确定性继续拖累交易，美国投资银行准备裁减更多职位。【原文：U.S. investment banks are poised to cut more jobs if economic uncertainty continues to weigh on dealmaking in the months ahead, according to analysts and recruiters.】

item.title: CD Projekt 称《巫师 4》不会在 2026 年推出后股价暴跌
item.description: CD Projekt 的股票在周三的早盘交易中下跌了近 13%，因为该游戏开发商称《巫师 4》的首映时间定于 2026 年之后，这加剧了人们对等待大片系列新作的时间更长的担忧。【原文：Shares of CD Projekt fell nearly 13% in early trading on Wednesday after the game developer said the premiere of Witcher IV was scheduled for after 2026, fuelling fears of an even longer wait for the new instalment in the blockbuster series.】

item.title: 德国跨境贸易游说团体警告不要抵制美国产品
item.description: 在欧洲各国政府与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）政府关系紧张之际，一个德国国际贸易游说团体周三对抵制美国产品的呼吁发出警告，称这些呼吁可能会激起一轮报复。【原文：A German international trade lobby on Wednesday warned against calls to boycott U.S. products amid tensions between European governments and President Donald Trump's administration, saying they could stoke a cycle of reprisals.】

item.title: 中国 Leapmotor 的目标是在 2026 年在欧洲推广智能驾驶技术
item.description: Stellantis 的中国合作伙伴 Leapmotor 公司高级副总裁周三表示，该公司计划明年在欧洲推出配备其智能驾驶技术的汽车。【原文：Stellantis' Chinese partner Leapmotor plans to roll out vehicles equipped with its smart-driving technologies in Europe next year, the company's senior vice president said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 法国 IT 集团 Atos 赢得英国政府 1.5 亿英镑合同
item.description: 法国IT集团Atos周三表示，该公司赢得了英国环境、食品和农村事务部一份为期五年、价值1.5亿英镑（1.935亿美元）的合同。【原文：French IT group Atos has won a five-year contract worth 150 million pounds ($193.5 million) with Britain's Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日产汽车新任首席执行官打算缩短汽车开发时间
item.description: 陷入困境的日产汽车新任首席执行官伊万-埃斯皮诺萨（Ivan Espinosa）周三表示，日产计划大幅缩短汽车研发时间，以提高竞争力。【原文：Nissan plans to dramatically cut its car development time to boost its competitiveness, the struggling automaker's incoming CEO Ivan Espinosa said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道：受制裁影响的白俄罗斯期待冈比亚为其枯竭的船队注入活力
item.description: 三位熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，受到制裁影响的白俄罗斯国旗航空公司贝拉维亚航空公司（Belavia）即将为其枯竭的机队增加三架空中客车飞机，此前这些飞机曾属于冈比亚神奇航空公司（Magic Air）。【原文：Sanctions-hit Belarusian flag carrier Belavia is on the cusp of adding three Airbus planes to its depleted fleet after repurposing aircraft that had previously belonged to Gambian airline Magic Air , three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Dollar Tree 将以 10 亿美元出售 Family Dollar 业务
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，Dollar Tree 接近以约 10 亿美元的价格将其 Family Dollar 业务出售给一个私人股本投资者财团。【原文：Dollar Tree is nearing a sale of its Family Dollar business to a consortium of private-equity investors for about $1 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 纽约主计长称，华尔街奖金总额激增 32%，创历史新高
item.description: 纽约州主计长托马斯-迪纳波利（Thomas DiNapoli）周三表示，随着交易的反弹，去年华尔街银行家的奖金增长了 31.5%，平均达到 24.47 万美元，但随着经济不确定性的增加，这种繁荣景象可能会减弱。【原文：Wall Street banker bonuses rose 31.5% to an average $244,700 last year as dealmaking rebounded, but the boom times may wane as economic uncertainty rises, New York State Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 东京燃气公司预计 26 财年净利润将增长近一倍
item.description: 日本最大的城市燃气供应商东京燃气公司（Tokyo Gas）在周三发布的中期管理计划中表示，其目标是在 2026 财年将净利润提高近一倍，并计划在美国进行扩张。【原文：Tokyo Gas aims to nearly double its net profit in the 2026 fiscal year and plans to expand in the United States, Japan's biggest city gas provider said in a medium-term management plan released on Wednesday.】

item.title: 比亚迪董事长告诉分析师，其目标是在 2025 年将海外销量翻番至 80 万辆
item.description: 中国电动汽车巨头比亚迪董事长在周二的财报电话会议上告诉分析师，比亚迪的目标是在2025年将其在中国以外的销量翻一番，达到80万辆以上，并将通过在当地组装汽车来克服关税问题。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD aims to double its sales outside China to over 800,000 cars in 2025 and will look to overcome tariffs by assembling cars locally, its chairman told analysts on an earnings call on Tuesday.】

item.title: 大众汽车股东保时捷 SE 表示寻求多元化投资
item.description: 大众汽车的最大股东保时捷公司（Porsche SE）周三表示，由于其持有的欧洲第一大汽车制造商的股份减值，该公司的税后业绩出现了 200 亿欧元的亏损，保时捷公司计划扩大投资并分散持股。【原文：Porsche SE Volkswagen's largest shareholder, plans to expand its investments and diversify its holdings, it said on Wednesday, after reporting a 20-billion-euro loss to results after tax because of impairments on its holding of Europe's top carmaker.】

item.title: 特斯拉表示将于下月在沙特阿拉伯上市
item.description: 根据特斯拉公司网站上的开业公告，特斯拉将于下月初在沙特阿拉伯开业。【原文：Tesla will launch in Saudi Arabia early next month, according to a post announcing the opening on the company's website.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Grab 为可能的 GoTo 收购案寻求 20 亿美元贷款
item.description: 彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道称，总部位于新加坡的 Grab 正在寻求筹集高达 20 亿美元的贷款，以支持其对印度尼西亚 GoTo 的潜在收购。【原文：Singapore-headquartered Grab is seeking to raise a loan of up to $2 billion to support its potential takeover of Indonesia's GoTo , Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Hillhouse 从 Blackstone 聘请了房地产投资部门的日本联席主管
item.description: 一位熟知内情的消息人士透露，Hillhouse Investment 已为其日本房地产投资业务聘请了共同负责人，以加强其在日本的业务。【原文：Hillhouse Investment has hired co-heads for its Japan real estate investment business, a source familiar with the matter said, as it bulks up its operations there.】

item.title: 养老基金 AustralianSuper 退出软件公司 WiseTech Global
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的养老基金周三表示，由于物流软件巨头 WiseTech Global 公司内部的管理问题，AustralianSuper 已出售其所持股份。【原文：AustralianSuper has sold its stake in logistics software giant WiseTech Global because of governance issues within the firm, the country's largest pension fund said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 台湾在美国可能征收关税前捍卫贸易和货币纪录
item.description: 台湾中央银行周三在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）可能征收关税之前为台湾的贸易和货币记录进行了辩护，称高经常账户盈余是一个结构性问题，华盛顿对此表示理解。【原文：Taiwan's central bank on Wednesday defended the island's trade and currency record ahead of possible tariffs from U.S. President Donald Trump, saying the high current account surplus was a structural problem and Washington understood that.】

item.title: 早间竞标战战兢兢期待 4 月 2 日
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 消息人士称，星展集团在收购印尼巴宁银行控股权的竞争中处于领先地位
item.description: 三位知情人士称，东南亚资产规模最大的银行星展集团是收购印尼帕宁银行控股权的领跑者。【原文：DBS Group , Southeast Asia's top bank by assets, is the frontrunner to buy a controlling stake in Indonesia's Panin Bank , three people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 日本议员称日元被低估，希望采取措施扭转外流趋势
item.description: 在执政党考虑采取措施帮助扭转资本外流之际，资深议员告诉路透社，日本的经济基本面表明，日元的实际价值更接近于 1 美元兑 120-130 日元，而不是目前的 150 日元。【原文：Japan's economic fundamentals suggest the yen's real value is closer to 120-130 per dollar rather than the current 150 levels, senior lawmaker told Reuters, as the ruling party considers steps to help reverse capital outflows.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，美联储主席古尔斯比认为利率将在一年后降低，但警告称存在不确定性
item.description: 据《金融时报》周三发表的一篇采访报道，芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，他预计利率将在 12-18 个月内 "适当降低"，但他补充说，由于经济的不确定性，下一次降息可能需要比预期更长的时间。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Austan Goolsbee said he expected interest rates to be "a fair bit lower" in 12-18 months but added that it may take longer than anticipated for the next cut to come because of economic uncertainty, according to a Financial Times interview published Wednesday.】

item.title: Anduril 称人工智能初创公司从特朗普新五角大楼看到了良好的 "氛围
item.description: Anduril 公司总裁克里斯蒂安-博斯（Christian Bose）说，这家人工智能驱动的防务初创公司的创始人因早年支持唐纳德-特朗普而离开了脸谱网。【原文：Anduril president Christian Bose said the AI-powered defence start-up, whose founder left Facebook over his early support of Donald Trump, has good "vibes" about the Trump administration's shakeup of defence and willingness to do things differently.】

item.title: 欧洲投资者表示，人工智能采用者实现目标的时间不多了
item.description: 在生成式人工智能领域投入巨资的欧洲公司需要在明年之前开始显示其巨额支出的回报，否则投资者就有可能在付出天价加入市场热潮后失去耐心。【原文：European companies that are spending big on generative artificial intelligence need to start showing returns on their massive outlays by next year, or risk investors losing patience after they paid sky-high prices to join the market boom.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，瑞银为斡旋瑞士资本妥协提出让步方案
item.description: 瑞士联合银行（UBS）收购瑞士信贷银行（Credit Suisse）以创建瑞士银行业巨头已有两年时间，熟悉相关讨论的人士称，该行正试图通过限制其投资银行的未来规模和持有更多资本来规避更严格的监管。【原文：Two years since it acquired Credit Suisse to create a Swiss banking giant, UBS is trying to head off tougher regulations by offering to limit the future size of its investment bank and hold more capital, people familiar with discussions said.】

item.title: 越南决定允许 SpaceX 的 Starlink 卫星提供互联网服务
item.description: 越南政府周三表示，它已做出决定，允许 SpaceX 在越南试发射 Starlink 卫星互联网服务。【原文：Vietnam's government said on Wednesday it had issued a decision to allow SpaceX to launch its Starlink satellite internet service on a trial basis in the country.】

item.title: 交易员思考特朗普关税前景，股市上涨，美元漂移
item.description: 周三，亚洲股市跟随华尔街走高，美元走势摇摆不定，因为市场在等待唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易政策在下周新一轮关税之前明朗化。【原文：Asian stocks followed Wall Street higher on Wednesday and the U.S. dollar meandered as markets awaited clarity on President Donald Trump's trade policy ahead of a new round of tariffs next week.】

item.title: 巴拿马未授权访问巴拿马科布雷铜矿
item.description: 巴拿马工商部在周二的一份声明中说，巴拿马没有批准对第一量子公司已关闭的巴拿马科布雷矿进行访问。【原文：Panama has not authorized visits to First Quantum's shuttered Cobre Panama mine, the country's Ministry of Commerce and Industry said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: Anthropic 在音乐出版商人工智能版权案中提前胜诉
item.description: 人工智能公司Anthropic周二说服了一名加州联邦法官，驳回了阻止该公司使用环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）和其他音乐出版商拥有的歌词来训练其人工智能聊天机器人Claude的初步请求。【原文：Artificial intelligence company Anthropic convinced a California federal judge on Tuesday to reject a preliminary bid to block it from using lyrics owned by Universal Music Group and other music publishers to train its AI-powered chatbot Claude.】

item.title: 石油因供应紧张而走高
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁对从委内瑞拉进口石油和天然气的国家征收关税，以及美国原油库存降幅超过预期，市场担心供应趋紧，油价周三在亚洲早盘攀升。【原文：Oil prices climbed on Wednesday in early Asia trade on concerns of tighter supplies after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened tariffs against countries importing oil and gas from Venezuela and after U.S. crude inventories fell more than expected.】
